Lines.Line: [BG:Balcony][Narrator] In the distant past, a lonesome girl watched the clouds disperse and the moonlight glitter.
[Narrator] She walked through the low cut grass, wistful yet worried.
[Narrator] While her vision laid low, she spoke.
[Juliet] Romeo, oh, Romeo, wherefore art thou Romeo?
[Juliet] Deny thy father and refuse thy name; Or, if thou wilt not, be but sworn my love, and I'll no longer be a capulet.
[Narrator] She stared at the ground in silence, waiting for a response. Then, spoke once more.
[Juliet] Romeo?
[Narrator] Her calls went unanswered.
[Juliet] Romeo, it's your line. You can't keep doing this for every scene. It's not a solo play.
[Juliet] For once I wish you'd grow up and start taking responsibility.
[Narrator] Her words echo through the garden, yet remain unheard.
[Narrator] Just then, a droplet found itself on her palm.
[Juliet] Eek! What’s that?
[Juliet] *Sniff*
[Juliet] It smells weird, almost like iron.
[Juliet] Wait..
[Juliet] Th-.. This can't be what I think it is...
[Juliet] Romeo, when I climb up there and you play one of your stupid jokes again, I swear I'll be done with this.
[Juliet] Should I even concern myself with this?
[Juliet] That’s right. I don’t have to deal with this anymore.
[Narrator] The maiden leaves the same way she came, yet now free of mind, having finally made her choice.
[Narrator] Juliet made up her mind and heart, unknowing of what lies above.
[Narrator] Or that her love has already gone away.
[Juliet] Ngh..
[Juliet] Ugh...
[Juliet] This dress is not made for climbing..
[Juliet] I swear this balcony gets more vine-y each time I see it. Is there even a use for plants on a wall?
[Narrator] She stepped over the ridge, feeling the cold breeze brush by.
[Narrator] The door stood widely opened, with the curtains flowing with the wind towards the darkened room.
[Juliet][BG:Bedroom] He never leaves this open... At least, not when he's gone.
[Juliet] He’s way too scared someone’d steal his precious wine collection.
[Narrator] She takes her first step inside, immediately followed by a quick tap backwards.
[Juliet] Eek! Why is it so sticky?
[Narrator] A quick thought crossed her mind.
[Juliet] Please tell me I won't find any magazines laying around.
[Narrator] She steps inside again, this time avoiding the puddle.
[Juliet] I can't see a single thing... Where did I leave my candle again?
[Juliet][FindCandle] Ah! Here we go.
[Juliet][LitCandle] There, now I can finally see-
[Narrator] Her eyes fall to the floor.
[Juliet] What…
[Narrator] The birds scatter as a piercing shriek cries through the silence.
[Juliet] AAAAHHHHHH!!
[Juliet] Is this... Blood?
[Juliet] What happened here? And where is Romeo?
[Juliet] If love be rough with you, be rough with love...
[Juliet] O ROMEO, ROMEO! WHERE ART THOU?
[Narrator] Her voice echoes through the halls, but silence is returned.
[Juliet] If no one answers, I should look into what happened here myself.
[Juliet] If something happened, I’d probably want to keep quiet, just in case the perpetrator is still here...
[Juliet] I should look into what happened here.
[Juliet]Lets see if I can find anything else...
[Juliet] Is that…? Wine? Romeo's favorite too…
[Juliet] Did that drunkard forget about me because of this?!
[Juliet] Romeo, you better show up soon or not at all!
[Juliet] How dare you forget about me after-... Wait...
[Juliet] Why does this wine smell… Metallic?
[Juliet] Is there blood mixed in with the wine?
[Juliet] Did Romeo hurt himself in an accident after getting drunk?
[Juliet] There seem to be footsteps covered in the liquid heading out the door...
[Juliet]...
[Juliet] Romeo's bed...
[Juliet] No Juliet, focus! These times of woe afford no time to woo.
[Narrator] Juliet looks around the room, but her eyes land on his bed once again.
[Juliet] ... Or... maybe just a little..
[Narrator] Juliet jumps on Romeo's bed and rolls around.
[Narrator] Suddenly, her eyes spot something on the ground. She descends from the bed for inspection.
[Juliet] It’s a broken wine bottle..
[Juliet] This must be where the puddle came from. But how did it break? And how did it roll under the bed?
[Juliet] Also, it smells...
[Juliet] Strange. Almost like blood...
[Juliet] Did he get drunk and hurt himself?
[Juliet] I hope he’s okay...
[Juliet] A sword? What’s that doing here?
[Narrator] The candle shines bright, revealing a red glow on the blade.
[Juliet] There’s blood on the sword... But whose blood is it?
[Juliet] More importantly, this sword is only used for traditional duels. He must've pissed someone off again.
[Juliet] That would at least explain why the room is so messed up.
[Juliet] But wait.. This sword isn’t from his family.. It’s from Tybalt?
[Juliet] Romeo o Romeo...
[Juliet] I can’t believe this is happening… And why is it so quiet? Where is everyone?
[Narrator] An echoing howl can be heard behind her.
[Juliet] What was that!?
[Narrator] She looks around her, formulating an idea of what the eery sound was.
[Narrator] Suddenly, she feels a painful jab near her chest.
[Juliet] Agh! Ouch.. What was... that-?
[Narrator] She gazes around the room, but her vision fails her. She sees flashes of white before her, as the pain strengthens and her vision turns to black.
[Narrator] Moments later, she opens her eyes, finding herself on the floor.
[Juliet] Who was that? What was that? Where are you!?
[Juliet] ...
[Juliet] Romeo?
[Juliet] ...
[Juliet] Something is wrong in this house. I need answers. Would there be people in other rooms?
[BG:Hall][Narrator] Juliet stumbles to the main hall, frantically searching for the people she believed were there.
[Juliet] Now where to go...

Text.AfterText: [Juliet] If I can find Romeo anywhere, he’d be drinking in his winery.
[Juliet] Maybe I can find some information in the library...
[Juliet] If anyone is around, it should be in the ballroom, right?

Lines.Line: [BG:Hall][Juliet]I need a key for this door... I mean, I could just break in? But lets try another room first.

Text.AfterText: [Juliet] If I can find Romeo anywhere, he’d be drinking in his winery.
[Juliet] Maybe I can find some information in the library...
[Juliet] If anyone is around, it should be in the ballroom, right?

Lines.Line: [BG:Hall][Juliet]Damn! Why is the door to the kitchen locked.. I wanted to steal a snack before exploring further.

Text.AfterText: [Juliet] If I can find Romeo anywhere, he’d be drinking in his winery.
[Juliet] Maybe I can find some information in the library...
[Juliet] If anyone is around, it should be in the ballroom, right?

Lines.Line: [Narrator][BG:Room3] Juliet sees multiple empty bottles, red colored footsteps and another sword lying on the ground.
[Narrator] Juliet hurriedly walks towards the door, before opening it. The passage creaks, revealing a dimly-lit winery.
[Narrator] She walks inside, finding many empty bottles spread out on the floor, with the room looking like a newly made mess.
[Juliet] There must be some clues I can find here...

Text.AfterText: [Juliet] They’re all spread out, and appear to be empty… Maybe Romeo is drunk after all.
[Juliet] These look like footsteps… Leading towards Romeo’s room. But there weren’t any leaving the room… What does this mean?
[Juliet] What’s this sword doing here?

Lines.Line: [Narrator] The candle shines bright, revealing a red glow on the blade.
[Juliet] There’s blood on the sword... But whose blood is it?
[Juliet] It has Romeo’s name engraved on it as well…
[Juliet] More importantly, this sword is only used for traditional duels. He must've pissed someone off again.
[Juliet] That would at least explain why the room is so messed up.
[Juliet] Romeo o Romeo… Please be safe.
[Narrator] Loud banging now fills the silence, afterwards accompanied by distant shouting.
[Juliet] Who is that? What’s happening??
[Juliet] Someone must be in the hall!
[Narrator] She quickly opens the door without hesitation, ignoring possible dangers.
[Narrator] She quietly tips to the door, laying her hands on the knob.
[Narrator] Unknowing of what has happened, or what’s to come, she opens the door until there’s a slit to see through.
[Juliet] I-I can’t... Something bad is happening...
[Juliet] I’m scared...
[Juliet] Romeo...
[Narrator] A whisper is heard.
[???] Juliet...
[Juliet] ...?!
[???] It were a grief so brief to part with thee. But it is not farewell. Not yet.
[Narrator] The pain returns to her chest, this time too much to bear.
[Narrator] Her vision weakens, seeing only a flash of white light, upon which her vision turns to black.
[Narrator] Her hearing goes next.
[Narrator] Then her touch.
[Narrator] Lastly, her mind.
[Narrator] Ready to go, but never to return.
[BG:Room1][Narrator] Julliet carefully enters the ballroom. It's very dark and it feels cold.
[Narrator] As Juliet enters the middle of the room she hears some soft mumbling and creepy laughter. She also hears some soft music.
[Juliet] Strange… Why do I hear all these when the room is dark and empty.
[Narrator] Then Julliet looks up to follow the direction of the sounds..
[Juliet] Are those...
[Juliet] GHOSTS! The whole room is filled with ghosts!
[Juliet] Perhaps if I look around a bit more, I can find more clues to what's going on. Or.. Should I ask one of the ghosts?
[Narrator] Juliet muster the courage to just go and try to ask one of the ghosts what happened.
[Juliet] Sorry... may I ask..?
[???] Tybalt! It was Tybalt!
[Juliet] Tybalt?
[???] He killed all of us! All of us for no reason at all!
[Juliet] Are you sure it was him?
[???] It must have been! Who else could it have been.
[???] I heard he had a duel with Romeo. He must have lost and vent his anger out on us!
[Narrator] Suddenly Juliet hears noises in the hall. She decides to check out what's happening there and thanks the ghost before she leaves.
[Juliet] Was this room always here? I don't think so...
[Juliet] That can only mean one thing, a secret room!
[Narrator] Juliet tries to open the secret room but suddenly hears something from the hallway.
[BG:Room2][Juliet] The library looks even messier than usual...
[Juliet] Not to mention the creepiness. It's very dark and way too silent.
[Juliet] It's almost like in horror stories...
[Juliet] Something must have happened in this room also...
[Narrator] Juliet takes a random nearby book and looks at it. Upon seeing its content she closes it right away.
[Juliet] ... Romeo you dirty pervert!
[Juliet] You already have me...
[Juliet] There should be some hints though, let's look around.
[Juliet] There’s a note!
[Juliet] But some letters are a bit faded and there are ink spots on it also, making it hard to read...
[Juliet] Something about murdering?
[Narrative] Juliet reads the letter a couple more times but she can't figure it out.
[Narrator] Juliet stares at the note until she hears a sound in the hallway and decides to go check.
[Narrator][BG:Hall] Upon entering the hall, Juliet sees Tybalt struggling with something.
[Narrator] Suddenly... she sees Romeo.
[Juliet] Romeo! There you are!
[Juliet] But-...
[Juliet] Romeo?
[Narrator] Juliet looks confused to Romeo's ghostly body, floating as he attacks Tybalt.
[Narrator] Neither of the boys noticed Juliet as they are too occupied with their fight.
[Narrator] Juliet stares at both of them and notices Tybalt is heavily wounded in the side.
[Romeo] Juliet! There you are! I’ve been looking for you.
[Juliet] Looking for me? I’m the one who's been looking for you all over this place!
[Romeo] Tybalt killed everyone, help me kill him!.
[Narrator] Juliet looks at Tybalt.
[Tybalt] Juliet it wasnt me, trust me.
[Tybalt] Juliet you should run.
[Romeo] Hurry!
[Romeo] I’m just getting rid of a murder! Help me get revenge.
[Tybalt] I only killed you because you would've killed me otherwise!
[Romeo] See! He admits it! Hes a murder! Now kill him for me!
[Tybalt] Juliet it wasn't my fault please trust me!
[Tybalt] Juliet! Run away before it’s too late!
[Juliet] Run away? But I finally found you guys!
[Tybalt] Romeo killed everyone, run before he gets you too!
[Romeo] I only want to kill you Tybalt!
[Juliet] Why?! Romeo what did he do?!
[Romeo] He killed me, now it's his turn to die! Help me.
[Tybalt] Juliet It's not like that, he went insane. Trust me.
[Tybalt] I’m just trying to protect myself, he wont let me off!
[Juliet] Romeo is this true? Why are you doing this?
[Romeo] Everything is his fault!
[Romeo] I can't be with you anymore because he killed me! Kill him for me!
[Juliet] Tybalt... Why?
[Tybalt] I’m just trying to protect both of us! Trust me Juliet, trust me...
[Juliet] Tybalt, how could you do this to Romeo...
[Juliet] You know how much we love each other...
[Tybalt] Juliet no! It’s not like that! Trust me! He’s trying to frame me.
[Juliet] I’m sorry Tybalt..
[Narrative] Juliet accepts the sword Romeo handed over.
[Tybalt] JULIET NOO!!!
[Narrative] Believing in Romeo’s words, Juliet ignores his screams.
[Juliet] Romeo wouldn't lie to me.
[Narrative] Juliet then kills Tybalt and Romeo smiles.
[Narrative] ...
[Romeo] I won Tybalt!
[Juliet] Romeo! This is not a game...
[Romeo] Juliet, take this poison and die with me.
[Juliet] Romeo..? You want me to die?
[Romeo] This way we can be together in the afterlife.
[Juliet] I don’t want to kill Tybalt!
[Juliet] Romeo you're already dead, can't you just let this go?
[Romeo] NO! HE HAS TO DIE!
[Tybalt] Juliet just run! I probably won't make it…
[Tybalt] I can at least try to hold him off till you're safe.
[Juliet] Romeo wont hurt me. Right Romeo?
[Narrative] Juliet looks over at Romeo who holds out a poison.
[Romeo] If you refuse to kill him, die with me instead!
[Juliet] R-... Romeo…??
[Romeo] Die with me Juliet, so we can be together again.
[Tybalt] See Juliet, he gone crazy! Don’t do it! Run!
[Juliet] ...
[Narrative] Juliet refuses to drink the bottle
[Romeo] If you refuse to drink it, I can always force you!
[Narrative] Juliet decides to run quickly before he catches her.
[Narrator][BG:Hall] Juliet carefully peeks into the hall.
[Narrative] She sees Tybalt on the floor, bleeding heavily. He notices her staring through the door.
[Tybalt] Juliet... Watch out... Romeo... run...
[Juliet] Tybalt!? Tybalt what's wrong!?
[Narrative] Juliet storms into the room and gets near Tybalt and grabs his hand.
[Tybalt] Watch.. out for.. Rome-
[Juliet] Tybalt!? Tybalt!? What happened!? Romeo? What's wrong with Romeo?
[Narrative] Tybalt passes away before he could properly explain.
[Narrative] Juliet, in panic as to what to do, looks around the room. Suddenly she notices a ghost floating behind her.
[Juliet] AAAHHH!!
[Juliet] Wait-... Romeo? Romeo that's you!?
[Romeo] Juliet...
[Narrative] Juliet stares at Romeo's ghost.
[Juliet] Romeo are you okay-... Well I guess not.. What happened?
[Romeo] Tybalt killed everyone.
[Juliet] Tybalt? Why would he? Also he said something about you?
[Romeo] He wouldn't accept our love. Killed everyone in a rage when I said I won't give you up.
[Juliet] Romeo... That's so sweet. But.. I didn't know Tybalt was like that.
[Romeo] Juliet.. We can't be together in this world anymore.. Would you die for me?
[Juliet] Die!? I don't want to die!
[Narrative] Romeo holds out a poison.
[Romeo] Die with me Juliet. We can be together again in the next life.
[Romeo] I can always force you!
[Juliet] Tybalt was right! Something is wrong with Romeo, I better run.
[Narrator] Juliet runs while Tybalt holds off Romeo, giving her some extra time.
[Juliet] Which room should I run to...

Text.AfterText: Unable to run away, Romeo catches you.

Lines.Line: [Juliet][BG:Room3] Is there any place we can hide here?
[Narrative] Juliet searches around to think of a good spot. But soon after Romeo and Tybalt already came racing in.
[Romeo] There is nowhere to hide for you now!
[Tybalt] Juliet.. We can't run or hide.. There's only one option left.
[Narrative] Juliet nods sadly as she knows what he means.
[Narrative] Juliet walks to Romeo and takes a deep breath.
[Juliet] Give me that poison… I will take it.
[Narrative] Romeo looks enlightened to her decision and gives her the poison.
[Narrative] Juliet grabs the bottle and takes her sweet time to drink it.
[Juliet] Romeo… Are you really sure you want us dead?
[Romeo] If you hesitate now, I can just force it down your throat.
[Narrative] Juliet shud her head and looked over at Tybalt.
[Narrative] When she sees she bought him enough time, she throws the poison bottle away and jumps aside.
[Narrative] Tybalt jumps in front of her and holds out a cross that banishes ghosts.
[Romeo] YOU TRICKED ME! YOU WERE JUST BUYING TIME FOR HIM!
[Juliet] Yes I was! I don't want to die but you won't listen!
[Romeo] YOU!!!!!
[Narrative] Romeo’s ghost disappears in a rage.
[Juliet] We did it Tybalt! We are safe now!
[Narrative] Juliet looks over at Tybalt who isn't responding. But he has already passed away from his wounds.
[Juliet] Tybalt...
[Juliet] "Death, that hath sucked the honey of thy breath,Hath had no power yet upon thy beauty."
[Tybalt][BG:Room2] Why did you go to this room?! There is nowhere to hide!
[Juliet] I don’t know.. I was in panic..
[Juliet] Do you think we can jump out of this window?
[Tybalt] We can’t, its too high
[Romeo] HAHAHA! You're both foolish! Now die!

Chapter6.1-ballroom-tybalt.Lines: [???] It's the one who killed us all!
[Juliet] These voices... It's from other ghosts!
[Narrative] Juliet looks up and sees the ghosts trying to attack them.
[???] We have to get our revenge!
[Narrative] As they mainly aim at Tybalt, Juliet tries to help him but is unable to.
[Narrative] Tybalt passes away and Juliet sits next to him in disbelief.
[Juliet] Tybalt.. You were the last one I had left...
[Narrative] With no time to mourn for Tybalt, Romeo shows up.
[Narrative] Juliet tried to stand up and run away but her shaken legs made her trip and fall down again.
[Romeo] Don't worry Juliet, we will be together in the afterlife.

Lines.Line: [Juliet] Which room should I run to...

Text.AfterText: Unable to run away, Romeo catches you.

Lines.Line: [Juliet][BG:Room3] Where should I hide...

Text.AfterText: [Romeo] You've chosen an interesting place to die at.
[Narrator] Unable to find Juliet, Romeo left
[Romeo] I can see you!
Unable to run away, Romeo catches you.

Lines.Line: [Juliet][BG:Room2] Wrong room! There is nowhere to hide!

Text.AfterText: [Romeo] Found you!

Lines.Line: [Juliet][BG:Room1] Where should I hide...

Text.OptionText: Hide by posing as a statue
Text.AfterText: [Romeo] You thought I wouldnt notice...?
[Romeo] I found you!
Unable to run away, Romeo catches you.
